intro: Lysimachia hanapepeensis, commonly known as Hanapepe wintergreen, is a flowering plant native to Hawaii. It is a member of the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its small, white to pink flowers and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and stream banks. It is considered a rare and endemic species, found only on the island of Maui. Due to habitat loss and invasive species, it is listed as endangered, highlighting the need for conservation efforts.
